name: Emanuel Lasker
description: A universal and psychological player, known for adapting his style to exploit opponents' weaknesses.

explanation.Aggressiveness: Lasker was adaptable, capable of attacking but never reckless.
explanation.RiskTaking: He took calculated risks to challenge his opponents without overcommitting.
explanation.KingSafety: He maintained a solid defense, ensuring his king was rarely exposed.
explanation.PieceActivity: His pieces were active and well-coordinated, but he didn't overextend.
explanation.PawnStructure: Lasker balanced structural integrity with dynamic play, adapting as needed.
explanation.KnightPair: He valued both knights and bishops equally, using them strategically.
explanation.BishopPair: Bishops were important in his plans, but not always superior to knights.
explanation.Defense: One of the greatest defenders in history, he was extremely resilient in tough positions.
explanation.CalculationDepth: He calculated deeply but also relied on positional understanding.
explanation.EndgameKnowledge: Lasker’s endgame play was exceptional, often outplaying his opponents in long games.
explanation.PieceSacrifice: He sacrificed material only when necessary, ensuring a strategic advantage.
explanation.CenterControl: He fought for central control, often maneuvering to gain positional edges.
explanation.PositionClosure: He could play both open and closed positions depending on the situation.
explanation.PieceTrade: He traded pieces smartly, knowing when to simplify and when to maintain tension.
explanation.KingAttack: Lasker attacked when the opportunity arose but did not force it.
explanation.Profilaxis: A master of preventing opponent plans, making him difficult to outplay.
explanation.PositionalSacrifice: He sometimes gave up material for long-term positional advantages.
explanation.KnightVsBishop: No strong preference between knights or bishops, using them as the position required.
explanation.PawnPush: Advanced pawns when needed but preferred strategic pawn breaks.
explanation.OpenFileControl: He effectively controlled open files with rooks, optimizing their activity.
